contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox University | name = Institute of Technology, Sligo | image = [[File:Itsligo-logo.jpg|thumb]] | native_name = Institiúid Teicneolaíochta, Sligeach | established = 1970 | faculty = 300 | head_label = President | head = [[Terri Scott]] | students = 6,500 | campus = {{convert|70|acre|m2}} | city = [[Sligo]] | country = [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] | website = http://itsligo.ie | address = Ash Lane,<br/>Sligo,<br/>Ireland | telephone = +353 (0)71 91 55222 }} '''Institute of Technology Sligo''' ({{lang-ga|Institiúid Teicneolaíochta, Sligeach}}) ('''ITS''') is a state funded [[Higher education|third-level]] educational institution situated in the town of [[Sligo]], [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]]. The Institute has three Schools and 9 Departments. The institute opened in 1970 as a [[Institutes of Technology in Ireland|Regional Technical College]] and adopted its present name on May 7, 1997.<ref>[http://www.irishstatutebook.ie/1997/en/si/0199.html Regional Technical Colleges Act, 1992 (Amendment) (No. 2) Order, 1997]</ref> Professor Terri Scott has been Director of the Institute since October 2008 and Dr. Brendan McCormack is the current Registrar. ==About== The Institute is fast-becoming one of the leading third-level education bases in Ireland{{Citation needed|date=November 2007}}. In terms of student numbers, only the [[Dublin Institute of Technology]] outranks its science department{{Citation needed|date=November 2007}}. IT Sligo also has the second best science department in the IT sector in Ireland, behind DIT. On the sporting field, the college has been very successful in ladies soccer and more notably the senior football team, who have won the [[Sigerson Cup]] three times in the last six years. Success has also been had in areas such as lifesaving, [[cycling]] and [[hurling]]. The college also caters for other sports such as indoor soccer, hand gliding and most importantly their infamous [http://www.itsligorfc.co.nr College Rugby Team], the best college rugby team in the north west Ireland. ==Latest news== IT Sligo's Team Hermes wins the Microsoft Imagine Cup 2011- a world student technology competition - in the software design category, in New York. http://www.siliconrepublic.com/innovation/item/22651-it-sligo-team-wins-at-micro == Gallery == <gallery> File:Itsligo-entrance.jpg|The main entrance to IT Sligo.
